using the seasonally adjusted unemployme.skill_description: Using the seasonally adjusted unemployment rates provided for June 2009 (11.5% for men 20+ and 9.7% for women 20+), calculate the absolute difference in percentage points between the two rates. Please present the result clearly (e.g., “The difference is X percentage points.”) and indicate which group had the higher rate.
evidence: [2025-05-02T17:13:00.222448+00:00] DataAnalyst delivered a perfectly accurate and concise calculation, clearly stating the 1.8 percentage‐point difference and correctly identifying men as having the higher rate. The response strictly adhered to the provided figures and instructions, making it an ideal contribution to the overall task.
